required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effect of High-dose Vitamin C Use in Covid 19 Positive Pregnants
clinical_study.official_title: High-dose Vitamin C Use in Covid 19 Positive Pregnants

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the effect of high-dose vitamin C use in covid 19 positive pregnants

detailed_description.textblock: Researchers will evaluate the change of peripheral blood values in pregnant women receiving high doses of vitamin c (7.5g); (hemogram, biochemistry (ast- sub-urea, creatinine, potassium, sodium, calcium, magnesium, vitamin d, homocysteine, ggt, crp)

primary_outcome.measure: evaluation of the change of peripheral blood values in pregnant women receiving high doses of vitamin C
primary_outcome.description: hemogram, biochemistry (ast- sub-urea, creatinine, potassium, sodium, calcium, magnesium, vitamin d, homocysteine, ggt, crp)

intervention.description: researchers will evaluate the change of peripheral blood values in pregnant women receiving high doses of vitamin C

biospec_descr.textblock: (hemogram, biochemistry (ast- urea, creatinine, potassium, sodium, calcium, magnesium, vitamin d, homocysteine, ggt, crp)

study_pop.textblock: Effect of high dose vitamin c (7.5gr) usage on blood values and clinical results in covid 19 positive pregnants

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- covid19 positive
- no lung disease
- no additional disease
- no vitamin C allergy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not pregnant
- have lung disease

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
